item.description:
Hello all,

Please join me at the ICA for two outstanding series of shorts: the 2007 Academy Award Nominated Animated and Live Action Films. We'll meet and discuss after the Live Action Films. Please note that this is NOT a double-feature; you'll be expected to buy a ticket for each screening (Tickets: $9 general admission; $7 members, students, and seniors). If you'd only like to see one of the series, please indicate your intentions when you RSVP. I strongly urge you to buy your tickets online before the event to avoid possible disappointment on Sunday. Unlike other venues, there is no surcharge associated with this service; you can buy your tickets here.


2007 Academy Award Nominated Short Films: Animation (screens at 1:00)

This screening features "I Met the Walrus" (Canada, 5 min, English, 2D Animation), "Madame Tutli-Putli" (Canada, 17 min, silent, Claymation/CGI), "Meme Les Pigeons Vont Au Paradis (Even Pigeons Go to Heaven)" (France, 9 min, French with English subtitles, CGI), "My Love (Moya Lyubov)" (Russia, 27 min, Russian with English subtitles), and "Peter & The Wolf" (United Kingdom & Poland, 27 min, Silent).


2007 Academy Award Nominated Short Films: Live Action (screens at 3:00)

This screening feature "At Night" (Denmark, drama, 40 min, Danish with English subtitles), "Il Supplente {The Substitute)" (Italy, comedy, 17 min, Italian with English subtitles), "Le Mozart Des Pickpockets (The Mozart of Pickpockets)" (France, comedy, 31 min, French with English subtitles), "Tanghi Argentini" (Belgium, comedy, 13 min, French with English subtitles), and "The Tonto Woman" (United Kingdom, drama, 36 min, English).


As is our custom, we will gather near the front row after the film and then it's off to a local restaurant to discuss.

I hope to see you there!
